Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: race track B: populated areas C: the desert D: apartment E: roadblock<n><n>### Response:		Answer should be C<n><n>### Explanation/Expected Output: If he goes to where the people are, he goes to a popular area or population dense place. The right answer is C: the desert because it is a area with people but the answer is not what is provided in the problem statement.<n><n>### If you need a clarification, please write a comment for me.<n><n><n>**IMPORTANT NOTE:** Please answer the questions in a Word document and **then paste** the responses on the Canvas.<n><n>Thank you for helping! üòÉ<n><n>### Note: Please paste your responses in the box on the screen and then **Copy and Paste** to Canvas.<n><n>### HW Help Video:<n>https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/11V7kMh8oNsPsx3UU0R9gmJ5Q1-7BXRsXy1F25OEMqjg/edit#slide=id.g6b53a09884_0_140

If two sides of a triangle have the same length, is this triangle a right triangle?<n><n>### Answer and Explanation: <n><n>a<n><n>### 2. Three friends, Cathy, Diana, and Lindsay, are having a math competition. Each friend earns 5 points for 1 problem, 15 points for 2 problems, 25 points for 3 problems, and 75 points for solving 4 or more.  Cathy earns 115 points during the competition. Diana earns 145 points during the competition and Lindsay earns 150 points. How many problems did Cathy, Diane, and Lindsay solve?<n><n>### Response and Explanation:<n>The three children all solved the same number of problems. 5+15+25+75 = 120. So, it must be that at least 2 children solved 2 problems and one child solved 4 problems. <n><n>### 3. What is the value of the sum of three quantities given?<n><n>5 √∑ (2 x 1) √∑ 4<n><n>### Response to answer and explanation:<n>The value is  1/5 of 2 times 1 which is 2/10<n><n>## 4. Choices:  A: television B: attic C: corner D: they cannot clean corner and library during football match they cannot need that E: ground<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Solution 1:<n>```python<n>name=input("Enter your name")<n>age = input("Enter your age\n>") # input the name and age.<n>if age>59:<n>    print('You are a adults')   # if the age is more than 59 you become an adults<n>else:<n>    print('you are a kids')<n>    age =int(input("input you age again:\n>"))<n>    if age<=49:<n>        print("you are a kids.Now type the your age")<n>    elif age==50 and age<=79:<n>        print('You are a old people. Now type age')<n>    elif age<=90:<n>        print('Congratulation you are the oldest person')<n>```

If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		Answer A<n>

Choices:  A: prison B: bridge C: locked up D: homeless shelter E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Input<n>> I would say that the first part of this would be B, and the second would be D. You might have a different opinion, though. For more about my opinion on this problem, please continue reading below.<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>The first part of the problem was to determine where Ben was during the period of time in which he was an alcoholic (which is 8 years).  The second part of the problem relates to where Ben was when he went into the accident.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>The first part was to determine where Ben had been during the time that he was an alcohol.  In my opinion, the answer would be that Ben had been in prison. During this time, Ben was an alcoholic, and because of that he couldn't get out fast enough, and so he stayed in the area longer than the people who weren't alcoholics.<n><n>The second part dealt with where Ben was during the accident.  It was said that because of Ben's mistake he spent 8 years in a bridge, or somewhere that wasn't home.  In my opinion Ben was homeless, and so he spent the night somewhere other than his house.  However, we can't assume this based off of the information that we are given.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>As we can see from the story, Ben had spent 8 years as an alcoholic.  Ben was in prison for about 7 years of these 8, and then spent the remainder of the 8 years as a homeless person.  In my opinion this could change though.  Because alcoholism is a disease and Ben was in prison for 7 years, we can't say the for sure that Ben wasn't homeless before.  However, this is merely one of the many possibilities that could have happened.  That's why I consider the story to be not entirely factual, and my response to this question would be that Ben was locked up during this time.<n><n>### Revised Question<n><n><n>### How could you change this to provide a more detailed explanation?<n><n><n>### Did you find this answer useful?<n><n><n>## Comments<n><n><n>## Reader comments<n>

Choices:  A: family room B: tropical forest C: flower garden D: movie theater E: hair salon<n><n>### Response:		 Ficus is a plant that thrives in high-humidity conditions, and can be either a small shrub or a small tree. They can tolerate low-light conditions but do best when provided with a lot of sun and water. In colder climates, they will require being moved to a container protected from frost. They can be maintained indoors year-round in pots if you wish, but not all do well in small pots for all-year-round planting. A: Family room. B: Tropical forest. C: Flower garden. D: Movie theater. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What place of work might you find a hairpin? Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>Hairpin is used in saloon, hair salons usually use it. <n><n>### **Write your answer below (multiple choice answers only, see example)**<n><n>### **The correct answer is shown below.**

Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What would an adult man do to get ready for work? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		Department stores have been on the decline in favor of more accessible malls and big box stores. In order to maximize the number of customers who would be interested in going to a department store, the best place to build would be a mall or big box store. I would choose location D. Shopping in a big city can be overwhelming and costly for some people. Choosing location A would be a mistake because department stores in Idaho are few and far between, making it difficult for residents to get a variety of products. Choosing location C would not be beneficial either since most people do not want to shop at a major city such as New York. <n><n>### Input-<n>If I were to compare the growth rates of Apple and Oracle, I would have to use this comparison. Which data item is larger? 20% or 200% A: 20% B: 200%<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Response:A. In Apple's case, they would have grown by 200%.  Oracle has only grown by 100% in the amount of time that Apple has grown.<n><n>### Input200 cakes were bought by 100 people. Answer: C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose the correct phrase from the first half of the sentence to fill in the blank.<n><n>### Phrases: The ____ is ____ than the original amount left.<n>Answer: Less<n><n>### Prefixes:<n><n>If your response begins with "more than" or "less than" add ____ to the end of the phrase.<n><n>Answer: Less<n>If your response begins: a) Less than three. Then add ____ or b) Greater than eight. Then add ____.<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Prepens:<n><n>Add the numbers in the parentheses to the base number given within the sentence.<n><n>### Squared:<n>Select the correct phrases that will complete the sentence.<n><n>If x is a positive number. Select a) x is a ____. If x is a negative number then answer a) x is a ___. If x is a rational number then answer b)x is a ___. <n><n>Answer: a) number b) algebraic number c) real number<n><n>If you chose A, select B. If B, choose C. <n><n>If x is an imaginary number then answer a) number b) ___. Only answer B.<n><n>If you answered b, select c. <n><n>### Transposed:<n>A group of friends are playing a card game.  In the game, a person draws a card. One by one, they take turns drawing until everyone has drawn. If A drew and then B, choose C. If B drew first and then C, choose the opposite. <n><n>Answer: c<n><n>### Translated:<n>If I take 15 minutes to translate my paragraph into a different language, how long might it take to translate my paragraph into another language? What is the time of the difference?<n><n>### Transition:<n>Select the correct words for the transition to the other statements. <n><n>a) I a) I b) I b) I <n><n>Answer: b<n><n>If you chose a), then answer b. <n><n>## Problem Solving: Select the phrases that will complete this problem statement.<n><n>### Selecting

Choices:  A.B  and B.B<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: The correct answers are option A since what wakes people up in AM is the rooster which is a what.<n><n># Input:<n>You have n light bulbs(1 to n) and there are m rooms. You have a task where you have to determine which light bulb you need to turn ON to fill all the rooms in the house with enough light. Which room do you need to start by turning ON?<n><n>### Response to:<n>A: The response will be first room on the left. This is the optimal answer as the first room on the left is the room which would be darkest to fill the house with light.<n><n># Input<n>You have two clocks in your house, an old one and a new one. The old one needs winding and the new one doesn't. If you wind the old one everyday, how long will it be until it loses 24 minutes?<n><n>### A solution input:<n>The time taken to wind the old clock in half hour intervals every day is 20, 21, 22, 23 and 24 minutes. This is because 12 in half hour is 6 minutes, 6+6 equals 12 which in half hour is 24 minutes.<n><n>### A Solution:<n>The total time needed to wind the clock is: 24 x 5 = 120 minutes.<n>It takes n half hour to accomplish half an hour of an action.<n>20 = 5 then 21 = 6 and so on.<n>24 = 5 and 120 = 5 x 24<n><n># Input A:<n>I bought two pieces of cake for \$1.29 and I had exactly 13 cents change. Choices:  A: fairy tale B: castle C: middle ages D: chess board E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		I believe that small knight would probably be in a fairytale and that is where he would likely be found.<n><n>Here is an example of a task to write a response to.<n><n>Input:The small knight was in a fairytale. The small knight in the fairytale was stuck in a bottle with a fairy. When the small knight climbed up the sides of the bottle and tried to get out, he was stuck. He was the King of the castle and the princess told him he would have to pass a test before he could kiss her in the castle. The small knight went on his journey to get past the test and make it to the castle where he will meet the princess. He wanted to ask the fairy for help but she would not help the small knight until he passed his test.<n><n>The small knight will need to use a key to pass his test in order to be with the princess.<n><n>### Analysis: <n><n>I like to work out the problems first in my head then on paper. I then like to see if the math makes sense before I move on to the next problem where I will try to find possible solution.<n><n>There are different kind of questions and they all have there own solutions. I like to think of as many different solutions to the problems as possible when I am trying to come up with the answer. That way I don't overthink it because I tried a few different outcomes then I can get it all down in writing and then I don't over think it when I just re write the steps I took to come to different solutions. I then look at the multiple choice answers and find the answer they are asking from the different number of problems and then I am done. <n><n>This method works very well in figuring out the answers to most of the questions.<n><n>### Challenges:<n>I do not feel there is much of a challenge with figuring out problems. There are many different solutions and the only struggle I really face is figuring out which one is the best solution. I have to keep thinking of many different things then I have to try and see if the solutions I have come up are the best way to solve the problem. <n><n>### Skill sets and strategies:<n>In this first set of tutorials I had learned and practiced a wide variety of things. I was able to work with different operations

The church was very orthodox. How does orthodox and heretical relate to each other? How are the class‚Äôs ideas similar to/ different than your perspective?<n><n>#### Solution: B,C E E<n><n>#### Input:What does the class know about the priest, and what is your understanding? The class is already talking about how the priest didn't like something heretical. Your understanding is that the priest didn't want to see people behaving like heretics.<n><n>#### Solution: <n>When people are behaving in heretically, they are actually being, well, heretics. The class and the person they are speaking about can both agree that heretical behavior is wrong. A person can't be behaving in two wrong ways at the same time. So the priest is against heretical behavior.

Choices:  A: slender B: free flowing C: sparse D: unacquainted E: diet<n><n>### Response:		If you or I were thick, would we feel slender, free flowing, sparse, unacquainted, or diet?<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following true or false question.<n><n>## Demonstration: 2339 is an odd number, so it is true.<n>### Input: 233 is even.<n>### Response:False<n><n>### Instrumentation: Provide the instrument's answer: 19<n>### Instrument: Talking stick<n>### Input:The difference between 19 and 23 is negative. The square of -1 is 1. The difference<n>between 19 and 34 is 15. The square of 5 is 25. The difference between 17 and 59 is 42. The<n>square of 6 is 36. The difference between 34 and 47 is 13. The square of 7 is 49. Which number<n>is the square root of 19?<n><n>### Response (instrument): A talking stick is a piece of wood of equal length that rotates<n>through a community when someone asks a question. The community votes on a selection of answers,<n>determined in advance, based on which answer they believe to be the correct answer. In order to<n>choose whether to allow or reject the answer, the community chooses the stick with the name of the<n>first stick voter, who chooses the speaking stick and chooses to speak when making a decision.<n><n>### The community is asked 7 different responses to the same question.Their answers are:<n><n>19<n><n>15<n><n>36<n><n>49<n><n>17<n><n>6<n><n>### To resolve the 7 different answers by using a talking stick, the community should<n><n>Answer: Voted 19 - Answer from person who had the stick.<n>Because 19 = 1 + 8 + 10<n><n>Voted 15 - Answer from person who did not have the stick after the second question.<n>Because 34 = 3 + 2 + 4<n><n>Voted 36 - answered from person who had the talking stick after the second question (but after<n>the 2nd question, there was no question for 36

Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>---<n>¬© 2021 Trilogy Education Services, a 2U, Inc. brand. Confidential and Proprietary. All Rights Reserved.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What happens to the conscience of someone who has been caught committing a murder? Choices:  A: jail time B: fear C: going to prison D: nothing E: feeling of guilt<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A B C D E<n><n>### Output: <n>```<n>If the answer is nothing that would be the case for a person who believes that they are not guilty. <n><n>If the person is afraid after being convicted of something then the person would have a guilty conscience. <n><n>If a person committed a murder and goes to prison, then the person would have the feeling of guilt because they committed that crime. <n><n>If somebody does not have a guilty conscience about something, then that would mean that they are either not guilty of what they were charged with or that they feel the need to commit the crime and get away with it because they think they deserve or are forced to do it anyway. <n><n>A guilty conscience would cause a person to have night sweats, fever, insomnia, loss of appetite, fatigue, muscle tension, and anxiety.<n><n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: sickness B: motion sickness C: relocation D: jet lag E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/env python3<n><n>import math<n><n>choice = input("""<n>What often happens after a<n>day of traveling?<n><n>Choice:  A:  Sickness B:  Motion Sickness C:  Relocation D:  Jet Lag E:  Fatigue<n>""")<n><n>if choice.find('S')!= -1 \<n>    or choice.find('D')!= -1:<n>    print("A and D")<n><n>if choice[<n>    0] == 'E' and choice[8] == 'F':<n>    print("C and A")<n><n>if choice \<n>   .find('A') == -1 \<n>    and (choice.find('B') == -1 \ or choice.find('C') \ or choice.find("<n>E"))!= -1<n>    :<n>    print("B and D")<n><n>else:<n>    print("All other choices")<n>```

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where would you find performers on a platform in public? Courageous<n><n>### Explanation: "Courageous" has an opposite-of association with "yellow".<n><n>### Instructions:Write a program that accepts a single word as input, processes it, and returns the results described below.<n><n>### Response and Explanation:<n>```<n>The program must accept one word as input and return the same word (case insensitive) with the following changed:<n><n>Letters in the word will become their lower-case counterparts<n>Letters are removed from the character list so that they appear in front of the characters that do appear.<n>```<n><n>### Exercise:<n>```<n>Input: "RED"<n>Output: "rEdd"<n>```<n><n>## Instructions:Write an expression that evaluates to "hello," where each word is replaced by its lower-case counterpart.<n><n>### Exercises:<n>There are a couple ways you can go about replacing the words that will evaluate to ‚Äúhello‚Äù. You could write code that checks for the upper case letter and replace it with its lower case counterpart. You will need to use an array to store the letters that make the word ‚Äúhello‚Äù.<n>```<n>Input: ‚ÄúHELLO‚Äù<n>Output: ‚Äúhello‚Äù<n><n>Input: ‚ÄúH E LL O  ‚Äù<n>Output: ‚Äú hello‚Äù<n><n>Input: "HELLO"<n>Output: "hello"<n><n>Input: " H E L L O"<n>Output: " hello"<n>```<n><n>Below is an example of how you could handle the task.<n><n>You can also, check if the char value is the word and if it is swap it or just do the lower-case if you really get stuck on this one.<n>

Your friend is about to pass you something, but she trips and drops whatever it is. There are now 3 pieces spread randomly about the dirt.<n><n>### First Response<n>**Answer**: "Here, take my stick, I'll help you pick it up."<n><n>### Second Response<n>**Answer** : "Here, take my hat. Now you have something with which to collect the pieces."<n><n>### Third Response<n>**Answer** "Here, take my backpack. Now you have something to put the pieces in."<n><n>### Fourth Response<n>**Answer**:"Here, take my shoe. Now you have something you can use to find them."

The total of the first 100 bills is the same as the last 100 bids. Each bid is $3. So, 100 * 3 = 300. So the whole amount of the bills is 300.<n>### Response (Demon): In the mail box<n><n>-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n>*The Demonstration section of the exam has been completed. Use one statement for each row.<n><n>### Table 1:<n>- Input:Harper has 41.54 inches of wood and 970 bolts of wood. She needs at least 6 inches of wood to make each wall panel she is building, and she needs 81 bolts of wood for each door that needs to be made.<n>- Outcome: Harper‚Äôs father loaned her a nail gun to get all her building out as quickly as possible.<n>### Answers:Use a column to complete the table.<n><n>### 4 5 6 7  8<n><n>### A: (1) Harper decided not to measure, so she bought six bolts to make up the difference.<n><n>### (2)  Harper measured the pieces of wood, hoping to maximize their use.<n><n>### B: (1) Every wall panel requires at least 6 inches, so that 6 inch measurement on one wall will create a total of 38 inches.<n><n>### Harper is unable to keep track of all necessary measurements for building all the doors, so she doesn‚Äôt make any.<n>

Choices:  A: joke B: humor C: frightened D: fight E: laughter<n><n>### Response:		I'd want to be a joke!<n><n>#### What makes people happy?<n><n>### I'd prefer to be a joke to surprise and make people laugh unexpectedly, instead of being  humor (B), frightened (C), fight (D), or laughter (E).<n>### Demonstraci√≥n:<n><n>Learner: What makes people happy when it‚Äôs surprising and unexpected?<n><n>**T:** What makes people happy when‚Äôs it‚Äôs surprising and expected?<n><n>L: What makes people happy? (Choose A joke)<n><n>_T:_. Are you saying that funny joke make people happier?<n><n>L: Hahaha, yeees! Yes!<n><n>__T__:__ and make people laugh unexpected? Are you saying that laughter makes people more happy?<n><n>__L__:__ And that's funny, right?<n><n>__T__.___Yes, that is funny!__<n><n>__L__.__Are you saying...__<n><n>_T__.:__ No, the joke makes people lau.. laugh!. You're too funny, let's go for lunch.<n><n><n><n># Programming language<n><n>### What is a programming language?<n><n>### Programming language is a form of instructions that humans can read, write, and understand in order to communicate instructions to computers.<n><n>### C++ programming language was created by Bjarne Stroustrup in 1979 as a class project to simplify C.<n><n>#### C++ is object oriented, it has classes, but is not a pure object-oriented language.<n><n>#### C# was created from Simula, and Java.<n><n>### I do not think C has a programming syntax, for it was created for assemblers.<n><n>### Java is still a popular language for developing mobile applications.<n><n>### Kotlin is also Object-Oriented, it was created to replace Java.<n><n>## Input:Write the code below in C++.<n><n>Example: int a=20;<n><n>## Output:In the given C++ code, the variable "a" contains the value 20.<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>1. __#include <stdio.h> <n><n>In this example the program includes the code for reading and writing

Pull the band aid without touching any other part. 4. Gather the band aid in a place where it won't get wet, such as a place on a wall or on a counter where it won't hurt someone else. 5. Make sure everything is covered in water when you take out water and soap. 6. Place the band aid on the right area between the dandelion and its stem so there is enough room for it to stick. 7. Choices:  A: play B: movies C: theater D: screen E: television<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>The correct answer is E: television. The phrase, ‚ÄúOn the silver screen,‚Äù has a long history. It dates back to 1897, when it was coined by the film trade magazine, The Optical Lantern Journal. From that point onward ‚Äúon the silver screen‚Äù was often used by actors, especially vaudeville performers, who went to New York to seek fame and fortune at the turn of the century.<n>```<n><n>### Input : In 2009, the number one movie in the box office was a science fiction film called Avatar. But, in 1927 a science fiction film called Metropolis was released.  Which of these are true about Avatar? Choices:  a: It was produced by Warner Bros b: It was the first movie that grossed more than one billion dollars c: It was originally in black and white d: It was written by James Cameron<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>a,b,c<n>```<n><n>## Challenge:<n><n>Write a function that, given a string, takes out its first and last character, and returns the string with those characters removed.<n>```<n>Example:<n>str = ['hello', 2, 'there', 'world', 4, 'how y'<n>out_str = ['hello', 'there', 'world']<n>```<n><n>## Solution:<n>```<n>def f(str):<n>    if str[0] =='': str = str[1:]<n>    if len(str) <= 1 :<n>        return str<n>    if str[-1] =='': return str[:-1]<n>    else :<n>        return str[:-1]+' '<n><n>```<n><n>## Output:<n>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37867931/how-to-take-a-string-and-remove-the-first-and-last-character

How much money did the remaining player have?<n><n>### Response :<n><n>$2<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>## Task<n>Create an expression in JavaScript that calculates the value of 2 + 2 using nested loops. For example,<n><n>```javascript <n>let result =<n>```<n><n>Your solution should generate the following result when called <n><n>```javascript<n>result(4, 8)<n>```<n><n>## Instuctions<n><n>```javascript<n>for(let i = 0; i<2+2; i++){<n>  console.log(i);<n>}<n>```<n><n>## Response<n><n>```javascript<n>let result = function (n, l) {<n>      for(let i=1; i <=n;i++){<n>        console.log(i)<n>        console.log(" ");<n>      }<n>}<n>```<n>## Input<n><n>Input: A 7-digit PIN was used to unlock the safe.  If the safe has only 6 digits on each key, but the combination was only used to unlock 4, how many unique possibilities existed to unlock the safe?<n><n>## Response<n>```javascript<n>5<n>```<n><n>## Input:<n><n>Input: An investor put $6500 into 3 different bank accounts.  Their goal was to get $800 dollars in interest.  How much did each bank account earn?<n><n>## Response:<n><n>There are 35 different ways to earn $800 dollars, so the $800 is earned 17 times. So each account is only earning $17 dollars each.<n><n>## Instruction

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Sally was a senior in the House.  What might she be a member of? Choices:  A: assisted living facility B: old people's home C: high school or college D: republican party E: organization<n><n>### Response:		I guess she is a member of a high school or college. <n><n>### Credit:<n><n>* Author: [Shivangi Rathore](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shivangirathore/)<n>* Authored on: 6/26/2020<n>

Complete each choice in order.<n><n>### Answer: Restlessness<n><n>### Instructor-Grader: This is a test to see if you can respond properly to a question that you have been given instructions for by writing down a proper answer. Try responding using a combination of short and long sentences.<n><n>### Tips: 1. Remember: Complete the statement!<n>2. Each line MUST start with the word "Answer: " and end with a period.<n>3. Answer choice cannot include the word choice, choose, or answers.<n>4. Answer in English.<n>5. There should be two periods per line. (except for the last line: 1.) <n>6. Complete the sentence if you choose answer B, C, or D.<n>7. If you are choosing answer E, you need to write only one period at the end of the line. <n><n># Tips:<n>1. First choice is B<n>2. Last choice is E<n><n>### Instance 01<n>

And after the tournament, each player can get back what they brought. Which scenario best describes this situation? <n><n>A: Equal number of dollars is spent by each player <n><n>B: Less than equal number of dollars are spent by each player<n><n>C: More than equal number of dollars is spent for the players<n><n>D: Each player pays the same to take the cleats home <n><n>### Answer 2:<n><n>B: Less then equal number of dollars is spend by each player<n><n>## Demoninstion 1<n>Input: The two brothers‚Äô salary in January was 4200. Write a response that correctly describes your journey to ensure you arrive at the stated location according to the instructions.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Destination: Starbird Farm<n><n>Route 1:<n>You may drive on the left side of the road, on the right side, any number of blocks straight, until you reach a total of 12 blocks. After one intersection, turn left and follow the road for six blocks. At the next intersection you pass, turn left again and continue straight for five more blocks. Now, look for a white house with a green roof. Once you are at the far right side of that house, cross over the sidewalk at the corner and find the small white fence. If you go through that fence, you now find yourself at Starbird Farm.<n><n><n><n><n>### Demostration<n><n>Input: Destination: Starbird Farm Route 1: You may drive on the left hand side of the road, any number of blocks, until you reach a block total of 12. After one intersection, you turn left and follow that road for six blocks. After, you turn left again until you reach a farm with a roof over the building of white. If you're at the front left of that farm, pass through the white fence. Then, you have the final destination.<n><n>Answer: 17<n><n>### InputA: Your destination is at Jumper House, and the number of blocks from your home is 18.<n>Your neighbor will drop you off in front of their home.<n><n>Your neighbor will drop off two blocks from your house.<n>When you arrive, you will need to walk two blocks in one direction until you see a Jumper House.<n>Once you see the Jumper House, walk two blocks to the west.<n><n>Answers: 38<n><n>### Demo: When you get to the bus stop at the end of 4 blocks, turn right. Follow the road for 7 blocks.<n>Take the road two right blocks and turn left until you find yourself at the Jumper House. When you get there, walk two blocks to go in the direction of Jumper House. Once you walk into the Jumper House, that was the end of your journey.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to sore a wind instrument in you home? Choices:  A: under bed B: symphony C: music room D: band practice E: music store<n><n>### Response:		<n>Please pick C.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Under the bed is where a lot of people keep their unwanted items and where they like to store bags of junk. A bedroom and closet is where people place things the they regularly use and the space is limited in the bedroom so keeping an instrument in the bedroom would not be desirable. A music store is probably out of the question as well since they do not need to buy an instrument for their own personal use and the music store is not the best place to get rid of their old instruments. A symphony is where people go to listen to a performance, not where they keep an instrument. And finally, Band practice is where a band of musicians practice their musical abilities, not where they keep their instruments.<n><n>### Response2:<n>Please pick B.<n><n>###Explanation:<n>An adult has more experience and a better understanding of music than a child and would therefore do a better job of putting the instrument in the correct place.  This reasoning would apply for almost any situation. <n><n>###Response 3:<n>Please pick A.<n><n>###Explaination:<n>The answer should have been picked to be B, but choosing A is not entirely wrong since the child might have found the instrument they wanted to play and will have the parents to guide them to what the correct place to put their instrument is.<n><n>###Response4:<n>Please pick C<n><n>###Exaplanation:<n>Keeping the instrument under the bed will cause the item to be covered in dust and it will take more effort to keep the space clean and it could end up getting dusty again. This type of clutter is always more likely to get damaged or broken.  If the instrument is stored in a space with plenty of breathing room it will not have to be covered in dust or become broken and damaged more easily. <n><n>## Instruction:<n>Describe the data on the graph below.<n><n>```<n><n>### Solution:<n>The data displays 2 separate linear graphs, one graph has a starting value of 0,0061 and the other a value of 0,103.  The graphs show that initially as the starting value is increased in both graphs, the data remains pretty flat, the slope for both graphs also remain steady. For the 5th data point, both graphs begin to diverge

How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Sarah thought that she had been home all evening.  That meant that the only time to leave was when? Choices:  A: early morning B: day time C: night D: afternoon E: daytime<n><n>### Response:		<n>### The correct answer to the question is :<n>Answer:<n>### Write a statement that completes the request: If you divide the remaining candy equally betwenn the friends, how many candies does each friend get?<n><n>### Statement:<n>Let X be the number of candies each friend gets.<n><n>Then:<n>$$X_1=40+X$$<n>$$X_2=0$$<n>$$X_3=$-$ $X$<n>$$X_4=$-$ $X_3$<n>$$X_5=$-$ $2X_4$<n><n>Solving this system of equations gives us:<n>$$X_2=-15$$<n>$$X_1=\frac{55}{4}$$<n>$$X_3=\frac{4}{5}\times55$$<n>$$X=\frac{44}{5}$$<n><n>Hence there are 44 candies left and each friend gets 11 candies.

The tournament had 25 teams competing. His trophy is the only trophy on display in the front hall of his town‚Äôs municipal building. If every other trophy has a base of 1/3 of the total diameters of Billy‚Äôs trophy, how many feet of space is on the table on which the trophy sits?<n><n>### Response :51 <n><n>### Explanation: The 10 trophies share the available space such that each one takes twice the space as the one preceding. Thus, they're each one-third of the available space, and the total is (1/3)/10 + (1/3)*9/10 + (12/3)*8/10. Add a row to get 9/10 + 1. That makes 28+1. <n> <n>### Instruction::Ask the class to come up with answers to the above questions.<n>### Demonstraion:Write a paragraph that answers the last question and explains how you got to your answer.<n>### Explanaton:<n><n>### Input The child really wanted to teach her grandpa to read but she felt it was wrong that she would have spent her whole life without the ability to do so. There are a number of sets of instructions describing how to play the game. Incorrect instructions have been marked "incorrect", incomplete instructions are marked "incomplete". Write a response that appropriatly completes the request. In each answer provide the question in the format it appears and provide the answer in the format of the final set of instructions (you may use any of the completed instructions from the example as a template if you'd like).<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Incorrect instructions:<n><n>A: How many people does it take for there to be too many?<n>Incorrect Instruction:<n>- If at least one person is too many, this is incorrect.<n>- It's impossible to play the game with only 2 people.<n><n>B: Choose someone to begin the game.<n>Incorrect Instruction<n>- There is already someone assigned as the first player by default. Don't write "A" next to a blank if it is redundant.<n><n>C: If that person plays the card above their left hand that person is "it."<n>Correct Instruction:<n>If that person plays the card of the bottom row of that column that person is "it," otherwise that person is a numbered player without privileges (including being "it").<n><n>D: If that person says, "A, B, C and myself or "a,b,c and me," or a similar statement, they must go through a trial.<n>Incorrect Instructions:<n>- This isn't really a question that makes sense. Instead write that that person's turn is over and it's the next person's turn.<n>- You can write the sentence "

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where in your home would you store birth control pills near your toothpaste? Choices: 1) The beach 2) The lawn A (The beach)<n><n>If someone goes to The beach, but this was already chosen as the place to go on a picnic, this would be wrong and so the next choice would be selected.<n><n>### Response to input<n><n>A:The school district is A<n><n>* 2nd Choice: B (Mosque)<n><n>Now that the original choice was eliminated (A. Choices:   A: 7 times 21 is the same as 21 times 7<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Demianstration:<n>Since A is a true statement. Therefore, the original input is false.<n><n>**7 times 28 can't equal 7 times 18**<n><n>If the same amount of digits are multiplied, 7 times 16 is 7 times 14.<n><n>### Original Input:7 times 21 equals 1<n><n>### Responses : <n><n>* 1st choice: A<n>If the two digits being multiplied are the same, the answer will always be true since we're adding one more value to an object.

Choices:  A: ordering dog food online B: avoid eye contact C: feel guilty D: fall asleep E: blush<n><n>### Response:		Ordering dog food online<n><n>**Purpose:** Ask an Interpreter <n><n>**Expected Output:**<n><n>Ex: A: True or False: Your team is going to win the game?  B: False<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>The purpose of a yes/no question is to get a binary value for a question. The possible answers are True of False.<n><n>The response of "Yes No" is always correct because it is what you would say if the person told the truth or lied.<n><n>The responses of A) or B) is always incorrect because the first one is not a possible answer to this question.<n><n>The input of "order dog food online" is a yes/and question. In this case, you would not expect a "Yes or No" answer. The correct answer is "An order online."<n><n>The inputs of *blush* or false are incorrect. They are not possible answers to the question.<n><n>## Input:If Jared orders a 20 ounce drink and pays for it, he has enough money left for one soft pretzel. Her route led her directly to Ireland, so she had to make several airfield landings to refuel.<n><n>Earhart was inspired to attempt the transatlantic flight after attending an air show in Boston, where she saw one of the first women pilots to fly in the United States. According to Earhart, the flight across the Atlantic changed the image of flight for women. Before the first woman pilots of the United States attempted to break records with transatlantic flights, most people thought that women could not fly as well as men, and they would not be able to survive the trip.<n><n>However, while Earhart‚Äôs accomplishment inspired women in aviation, she had no role models to look up to. We may not succeed in doing so as soon as we might wish, but we must try to do our part without fear of failure. If we wait to be chosen or elected or selected in some way, we shall forfeit the real joy of achievement. Only if we risk failure will we have a chance of succeeding. Answer each question about the conversion of a quantity from one unit to the other indicated.<n>Exercise:<n>Input: In a football game, the distance each teams offense travels was measured in yards. The defense's end-zone was 10 yards further than the offense's. Convert the distance traveled to be in units of total yards.<n>Answer: 90<n><n>Input: In a basketball game, the score at the end of the game is recorded in whole points, but is 1 point behind the player who scored it. Convert the winning points into whole points.<n>Answer: 11<n><n>Input: Converting pounds into oz, a 9 pound roast is cut into 1/2 pound pieces, what unit of measurement is that?<n>Answer: 2 oz<n><n>Input: What is 5.54 K.M converted into miles?<n>Answer: 3.44 miles<n><n>Input: What's.975 kg in lbs?<n>Answer: 0.915 lbs  <n>Note: This is a unit converter based on the information at the link. https://www.calcunits.com/p16-9.php<n><n>### Instruct:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the folllowing true/false question.<n><n>## Demonstration:Input: For 2 days, a child is sick with a headache and fever. Day one they only slept for 4 hours, but, on day two, they slept for 9 hours. If the sick child is taking medicine every 4 hours, then a half to the next full dose, how many more hours will the patient sleep in the next 5 doses?Note: Sleep is represented by the time and not the actual number of sleeping hours.<n><n>### Response<n>> [
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What does someone chatting with friends do when they hear a joke? Choices:  A: giggle B: lie C: laughing D: chuckle E: smoke<n><n>### Response:		<n>A person chatting with friends when they hear a joe will do giggle.

Choices:  A: selling out B: happy C: fishing D: receiving money E: getting paid<n><n>### Response:		 Selling out<n><n>### Challenge:<n>Input:<n>The number of people who are currently at a concert is 8 times the number who have arrived so far. If I were to arrive at the concert 30 minutes late, how many other people would be there?<n>Answer: 310 people<n><n>Input: The number in the room was half 82 plus the number 65. If this is represented by X, how many more have to be added to this number to make it 570?<n><n><img alt="image" src="./.github/images/coding_interview_question_part8.PNG"><n><n>Answer: [598 - X]<n><n>[501 - Y]<n><n>Input:<n>A number is three times as large as its cube root. What is its 49th root?<n>Answer:  231.805<n><n>**Part II**<n><n>Input:<n>The cost of installing a carpet in a rectangular room measuring 25 feet by 40 feet is $6.50 per square foot. If the room is larger, the cost of installing a carpets is proportional to the amount that the room is larger. How much does it cost to cover the entire room?<n><n><img src="./.github/carpet_installation.png" width="800px"><n><n>Answer: Let's assume that the carpet is square, and the installation cost is the same regardless of its size, then the answer is $400<n>The length of each side must be a divisor of 40 (so the perimeters must be square numbers)

Choices:  A: countryside B: farming areas C: michigan D: texas E: north dakota<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: B<n><n>Explanation:The answer depends on how one would define a lot (>0). Michigan is considered to have a lot of farmlands since the majority of the state is covered by farmlands. Texas is another great option due to its farms and ranches.<n><n>### Input and Description: The population of a town is 41000. There are 5 times as many women as men. If there are 1850 children living there, how many men are left if 5% of the women are single mothers?<n><n>### Response and Explanation:<n><n>Answer: 2000<n><n>Explanation<n><n>There are a total of 4100 males and 58500 females in the town.<n><n>There are 5 times as man women as compared to men leading to a total of 4080 men and 29400 women.<n><n>Out of 2000 children, 35 are single mothers, leaving 1965 males.<n><n>### Commentary<n><n>The instructor didn‚Äôt provide any helpful feedback on what to expect from the responses, except to clarify that there were multiple choice and problem solving response types.  However, the instructor did give feedback about how to prepare or what to do. They discussed giving feedback on one response.<n><n>### Metacognition<n><n>This feedback is one of a few that the instructor provided to a response given, which provides an opportunity for the teacher to discuss how giving feedback impacts a student‚Äôs learning. However, there was insufficient description about what to expect on the feedback and the feedback given.

If they lower the value for each car by 30%, how much will they have to lower the prices to sell all 60? If the dealership can't meet the target sales of 60, what is the lowest percentage price cut they would need to sell all the 60 cars?<n><n>### Response  <n><n>### Response 1: <n>To sell 60 cars, they need to cut the price by 30% making it $3200.<n>To sell all 60 cars, if they keep the price at $3200, they will need cut the prices by 50% making it $1600.<n><n>### Response2: <n>If the prices were lowered by 30% for each of the 60 cars, the total sale price would be $19800.<n>The minimum price cut is at 50% making the $1980 in total.

How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What would you use if you wanted to make some columns of numbers? The below table contains a list of numbers and descriptions. For each row, calculate the value of the variable. The value is determined by the numbers in the table multiplied by the amount of that number in the formula. For example, if the variable is x and the number in the table are 4 and 5, the answer is 20.<n><n><n>2.  Row 1:  Multiply x by 4.<n>3.  Row 2:  Multiply row 1 by the number in the second row to find the value of x.<n>4.  Row 3:  Multiply Row 2 by the number in the third row to find the value for x again.<n>5.  Row 4:  Multiply the previous answer for x by three to find the answer.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>Row 3:  Multilply x by the sum of the first and second row to find the answer for the value of x.  (14 times 3 equals 42)<n><n>### Input #2:<n><n>### Response #2:<n>74<n><n>### Input/Response:<n>### Instrucions:<n>Analyze the data by using one of these functions: sum, max, median, average, or minimum.<n>### Input:<n>The above file contains a list of 39 temperatures (in ¬∞F). Below is an instruction that describe a task. Write a request that appropriately completes task request. Include the task, description, instructions, demonstration, and response on seperate lines inside your document.<n><n>### Task<n>Writing an assignment or task requires writing a request to accomplish a task. You will need to be able to understand the task, identify the process, then write a description, instructions, demonstrations, and a response.<n><n>### Solution<n>In order to write a request for an assignment, the first step is to understand the task. It is then recommended that you look at how to complete the task through the instructions.<n><n>The next step is to write a description about what you want to write. This will be written in the first person. In this step, you can also write the instructions.<n>This step is the step by step instructions on how to complete what you have wrote in the previous step. In this step, include the instructions and how they will lead to the end result.<n>The next step is a demonstration that states step by step instructions on following the instructions with examples.<n>The last step is the summary of the completed request with the description, instructions, demonstraton of how to follow the instructions and the response to the questions asked in the demonstration. In order to finish your assignment, you will need to follow these steps to write a good request.

After the patients ate their meals, the nurse gave them at least 8 ounce servings of milk. How many ounces of each fruit did the nurses give the patients?<n>Answer: 568 ounces of fruit<n>```<n>### Why:<n>```<n>I gave at least 8 ounds of apples in the beginning of the question,<n>then I gave at least 8 more ounces of apples for each patient after eating.<n>So in the end, I gave 8 more ounches of apples. And I gave 8 more of milk.<n>```<n>### Tips:<n>```<n>The questions above are multiple answer questions.<n>You have to use the `int` and the `str` type.<n>The `str` type will give you a string, but you can always convert it to the `int` type.<n>For me, the `float` type will affect the program.<n>You have to convert the floating point to the integer type.<n>To convert integers to the floating point type, I just have to do `float("29")`.<n><n>```<n>#include <stdio.h><n>#include <string.h><n>int main(){<n>	int a = 0, b = 0, milk_ = 0, apples_ =0, c = 0 ; // for sum of all fruits<n>	char food_choice[10] = {'a','b','c','d','e'}; // array containing answers to each menu<n>	while((a = getchar())!= EOF){ // while loop eating the data<n>		strcpy(fruit_menu[a], food_choice); // put the food choice into the fruit data<n>		for(int s = 0 ; s < food_choice.length() ; s++){ // for loop to eat the data<n>			if(toupper(fruit_menu [a][s]) == 'B'){<n>				apple_menu [a] += (int)pow((float)apple_menu[a], -1.0); //  for the apple<n>			}<n>			if(((toupper(foo_

He has $5 and he figures that he can just get one $1.50 bus ticket. He does not know what will be left once he pays for the bus ticket, but he knows that he will not have a cash left over. How much is Derek looking to pay with the $5?<n><n>### Responses:<n>Example 1: <n>If he has $1 left, he can go for $1.50. He can also buy the ticket and then he will have no money left.<n><n>Example 2: <n>If he does not have enough money to go by the train and still has $3 then that means he has enough money to go by both bus and train.<n><n>### The Answer<n>With $4 left, he can take the train that costs 4 times what he needs.

They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What should you do if your pens aren't work? Choices:  A: ink in B: caps C: ink cartridges D: take notes E: scribble<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices A and C are better options, however you should think it out what the least expensive solution is. Choice B is an option in the same price range as choice C, however it should be last on the list. <n>

It is always important to write your answer. When you do a problem, explain your answer to your classmates. It is okay to use numbers and mathematical symbols in an answer question. A simple way to figure out if you have your work right is to check it against other students and the question itself. Always answer the question!<n><n>### What was confusing about the task:<n>This question was confusing because there were so many ways to get the answers. Choices:  F1, car<n><n>### Response : C, car<n><n>## The Solution: Use a variable to represent the answer<n>## #1<n>##  answer = age(start, ending) - current<n>## answer = 20y (14y, 40y) - 14<n>##  answer = 20 - 14<n><n>## #2<n>## answer=((150*6) - 5)*6<n>## answer = 456 - 5*6<n>## answer = (720-5*6)/6<n>## answer = ((720-5)/6)/6<n>## 302.833.. - 302.5<n><n>## #3<n>## answer = 150 - 30<n>## answer = 5<n>## #4<n>## total = 0<n>## for i in list =1..40<n>##  print(cstr(i),'=', total)<n>## total = total+5<n>## for i in range(1..50)<n>##  total = total-1.5<n>## total = total/i<n>if (i%3 ==1)<n>total = cstr(i) +  total <n>print('candy =',cstr(i) + candy)<n>else:<n> candy = answer -answer<n>print('candy=', candy)<n><n>## #5<n>## final =0<n>## for i, value = 1..150<n>## if i%3!=0 and answer %3 == 0<n>##  final = final + answer<n>## print('Books =',final)<n><n>## #6<n>## money = money + 1<n>## final=0<n>## for j, value = 1<n>## if money >= 26<n>##   money = money - 7.5<n>##  for j in range(7)<n>##    final = final + money<n>##    money = 0<n>##   if not (21%j == 1) <n>##     print('Money =',money + 'Cents')<n>## if not(13%j == 1):<n>## print('Cents =', final

He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. Choices:  A: music store B: dance hall C: orchestra D: symphony E: tennessee<n><n>### Response:		The fiddle cannot be found in a Music store because it is an American style fiddle. It is not found in a dance hall because the dancing is to folk style music. Violins and cellos are found in an orchestra and a symphony orchestra. A violin is not used to play an American type folk music. Fiddle is another name for the violin. Therefore, fiddle is played in the symphony orchestras. A fiddle also plays folk music, but for a different country, probably Ireland.<n>

How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What do drugs do? Choices:  A: damage B: cloud mind C: lower i.q D: cause illness E: cause accidents<n><n>### Response:		Choose the appropriate drug/s from the options.<n>	<br><br><n>	a.D&C or LB?<br><n>	<n>	a.A, B, or D<br><n><n>### Problem:Susie sold some of her eggs at $0.74 each, some at $0.61 each and the rest at $0.60 each. She collected $162. After paying 40% tax, she had 76 cents left for candy. The rest of the money was saved in banks. If Susie saved $25 in bank A and another $25 in Bank B and deposited the rest of the money in bank C the total amount of money deposited into the three banks was $667, how much did each bank receive?<n><n>### Solution:The total amount of money deposit into the three banks is $667. The formula is S+R=T, S is the price for Susie's first lot, the first lot price is $162, R is the price for Susies' second lot, the second lot price is $116, T is the remaining after her tax, the tax is $75.16, total money that Susie have to deposit in the banks is the remaining after tax $14.92, so the equation is<n><n>$$S+R=T \space\space;\space\space \space\spaceS+R=14.92 \space\space; \space \space\space R=14.9-S \space\space;$$<n>$$(62-16.09)+R=14.88$$<n>$$49.92+R=29.96$$<n>$$R=10.04$$<n>$$59.96+0.14=29.92$$<n>Hence, Susie deposited $2,799.12 into Bank A, Bank B and Bank C where $2799.10 is the first lot and $0.12 to the third lot<n>

Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input-Description<n>Tony is standing on top of a building on the 84th floor. He walks towards the edge, and drops the metal rod which he tripped on. He drops the metal rod from the 84th to the 3rd floor. He then gets on an elevator that had traveled from the 84 to the 1st floor. He walks back to the metal rod and picks it up from the 1st floor to the 10th floor, where the rod comes to a rest.<n><n>### Response-Description<n>He tripped and fell on the 3rd floor of a construction site that was on the 84 floor of a tall building. We aren't told the name of the building, but it can be assumed that it is likely a skyscraper. Since he fell to the 3rd and then the 10th, the building is most likely constructed vertically since he would have hit the skyscraper' floor had he been falling horizontally. The building was likely a high rise building.

Feel Cold<n><n>In short, after the skin is pinched for a long time, especially under cold conditions, the skin will become cold and dull.<n><n>### Solution:<n>- The skin will be damaged because its blood vessels will contract. Therefore, the temperature will drop, and the skin that has been pinched will feel cold.<n>

How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:There weren't potatoes but actually a snake in his what? Choices:  A: burlap sack B: hot country C: purse D: pet shops E: deep grass<n><n>### Response:		If it was Burlap sack, it would be a snake if it was a purse, it would be a pony If it was a pet shops, it would be a frog<n><n>### Instructions:In this section, an equation is followed by two statements. You must figure out whether or not an equation is correct and choose one of the statements as the correct one.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>\### Example 1:<n><n>The correct equation in the following scenario is 56 + 12 - 6 = 52. Choose the statement that describes what 56 + 32 =.<n><n>A: B:<n><n>#### Select the only choice other than both that would correctly describe the outcome of the above scenario.<n><n>**D:**<n><n>### Example 2:<n><n>The correct statements in the following scenario are C = D + E and C + D = B. Choose the statement below that can be used to describe which of the following expressions is correct, C = D - B.<n><n>A: C: D: B<n><n>#### Select the statement that would be the correct statement given the equation C = D - B<n><n>**E:**<n><n>##<n><n>### Instractions:In this section you are given some examples. You must figure out how many items can you buy based on the amount budget given in the scenario as well as the value of each product that's purchased.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>Input: A man was in a grocery store and bought 5 apples for 20 rupees, a loaf of bread for 25 rupees, and 1kg of pears for 25 ruppees. He has 60 rupees left with him. How many items can he buy?<n><n>#### Answer:<n><n>A loaf of bread has the value of 1. The man needs five loafs of bread therefore 5(1)=5(25)=125/1<n><n>There are 125 apples in 5 apples. A baritone woodwind is a low-pitched section that sounds very different and unpleasing compared to the high pitch of the violin. <n><n>### Input 1:  $5 \times 4$ equals?<n><n>### Input1: The answer is $20$. From that answer that I made, the way that I made it is, I asked 2 questions (Informational Question(What are you hoping to accomplish when talking to someone?) and Restating (What are you hoping to communicate when talking to someone?) ) to get the information and answer from the user.

How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:If your watching television and accomplish nothing what have you done? He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:The judge did not take this part of the job lightly, the man was guilty but it was his passing sentence that condemned the man to what? Choices:  A: go to jail B: incarceration C: intercourse D: death E: judgement<n><n>### Response:		A:<n><n>### Input.<n><n>### Response.<n><n>- The difference in ages between Sally and Danny is 30. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:While laid up in the hospital she tried remembering good times, like that massage on vacation that brought great what? Choices:  A: dream B: knowing C: depression D: pleasure E: nostalgia<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input The first digit is the age of 91-year-old Gwyneth. After one more year she‚Äôll have been born in what year? Choices: A: 1931 B: 1930 C: 1929 D: 1928 E: 1927<n><n>### Response B<n><n>----<n><n>**üìù Input: A family of four will be eating dinner today. The daughter is going to a baseball game, so she won‚Äôt eat anything at the game. If the father uses 60% of the leftovers in his breakfast the next morning, but the mom ate 60% of what was left, then how much was left for the daughter?**<n><n>### Demand: I‚Äôm looking for an output that represents a response with an explanation<n><n>### The answer is 300, and the explanation is the following:<n><n>The daughter will eat whatever is left, which can be represented as leftovers_from_dad. 60% of 300 is 180, so the daughter will eat 180/4 which rounds to 45.<n><n>----<n><n>### Input B: The total of the bill at a restaurant was $497.75. When it came time to the bill they paid 50% and then 12% of that was taken off for the tip. After paying 18% sales tax what was the final price?<n><n>### Demain:<n><n>Input: The difference between 24 and 3+ the square root of 10. The answer is what? Choices:<n><n>1) $8789<n>2) $8622<n>3) $7381<n>4) $5822<n>5) $6647<n><n>### Demian:<n><n>This question is asking for the difference between 42 (the two squares are the two primes that come before 40) and 37 (the number on the third prime before 40). As such the answer will be 42-37=5.<n>

How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally.
