Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where could you put a dollar that would make it hard to get out without breaking? Choices:  A: cash drawer B: piggy bank C: purse D: box E: pocket<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Response Example:<n><n>#### A. Cash Drawer<n><n>**Input:** Putting money in a cash drawer should keep it out of the hands of a child, who wouldn't be able to put it back in where they found it for safe keeping.<n><n>#### B. Piggy Bank<n><n>**Input: ** A piggy bank should be able to hold money that can then possibly be used for something worthwhile later. For example, maybe a book, or perhaps toys. Making a deposit in the bank should be a rewarding experience for any child.<n><n>#### C. Purse<n><n>**Input: A purse is a good choice, because it's used by women.<n><n>#### D. Box<n><n>**Input: For extra security, I would lock up the dollar in a lock box.**<n><n>#### E. Pocket<n><n>**Input: Pocket is a good place for small bills. However, I would make sure that it<n>is securely fastened.**<n><n>### Review<n><n>If you wish to review how to do these sorts of problem solving questions before tackling the practice problems, please view our math module on [Arithmetic problems](./Arithmetic) and follow along with [Video: Solving Math problems that have multiple-choice answers](https://www.education.com/career-certification/teach-pre-k/solving-math-problems-have-multiple-choice-answers).<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>In the example above, the correct answer to the question of how much does Samuel have left, is 132, as he is left with $132.<n><n>Now think of how you can use this concept to your advantage to try and solve your next problem.<n>

Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A.<n><n>* Diving off a cliff often ends in exhilaration.<n><n>### Input:(Give the question in full context)<n><n>### Response:(Write up an answer based on the context)<n><n>* A: When you are at a concert, the correct spelling is 'Deer Hunter' and not 'Dea Hunter'<n>* B: The correct answer is not 'Bats', but 'The Hurricane', because it is a very important movie for people today. It can teach you many things, like how to play football well. It can also teach you how to run a high risk high gain business. In the end, this question should not even be on quora. You wouldn't ask me, what is your favourite movie? I would say 'The Hurricane'. Well, that's the end of my answer.<n><n>### Note:The answer is not given in a paragraph. It should be on a separate line.<n><n>* A: Yes, if you are really old, you would get all of your money saved.<n>* B: The question is not about what will become of the dollar in terms of its price in the future, but in terms of its value. It might mean how much of the money you save today is not enough for you to live on in the future because of inflation. And that is why a 20 dollar bill doesn't mean much anymore, it doesn't even give you 20 bucks in value anymore, and that is what the question means when it asks 'how about $20'.

He knows that it will be a good fit and he has experience, but he doesn't have all the qualifications that they're asking for, so he's worried about what? Choices:  A: acceptance B: rejection C: hope D: less sleep E: employment<n><n>### Response:		C, James has hope that he will get hired even though he doesn't have the qualifications.<n><n>### Detailed explanation:The difference in ages between Richard<n>and Hurley is 24. If Hurley is six years old, what are the combined ages of Richard and Hurley from forty years ago?<n><n>The ages they are 12.<n><n>They plan to do this:<n>1. Choices:  The share can be anything over $5 The share is the cost of the soda The share is nothing over $5 The share can be anything The share is $5<n><n>### Response I want the soda cost<n><n>### What does it mean for a list to be a subset of another list? A set is a subset of another set if the elements of the sub set are included in the other set as unique elements. Examples:  All of the numbers 1 to 7 are included in the larger list containing all whole numbers. All of the students in Mr Smith's math class are part of the larger list.<n><n>### Response None<n><n>### What will happen to the $50 in your shoe and sock bank if you put $100 in instead? How much is on your debit and credit side once the new $50 is added?  <n><n>### Demonsration:<n><n>### Response <n><n>### Input $500<n>

Choices:  A: hill B: gorge C: sandplain D: cliff E: mountain<n><n>### Response:		4 C<n><n>### Description:<n>Write an answer to one of these questions.<n><n>Criteria:<n>Your answer must include a statement that answers the question and is supported by a complete and grammatically correct sentence that correctly applies the format of your code.<n>Your response must include your code and should explain how your response was derived with relevant code.<n>Your answer must include your comments and explanation of your thought process. <n><n>### Input<n><n>Sam found a giant hole‚Ä¶<n><n>### Response<n><n>I selected choice C.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The text describes a ‚Äúgiant hole‚Äù and asks what type of landscape this would be. A feature of a landscape is referred to as a type of feature. For example, a sandplain is a type of landscape feature. If a landscape has many features, then it is called a type of landscape. Therefore, a sand plain is a type of sand feature, and would fit as a choice in the response.<n>

I‚Äôm reading my last book right now.<n><n>### Response<n><n>I'm surprised to hear you say you're bored when reading. But you're not alone: A lot of people get bored quickly reading. That's why libraries exist. They help people find books that they enjoy reading and spend time with. You can learn even more about books by reading the books you're reading. I personally prefer reading longer and thicker books. I love reading about dinosaurs and other creatures that lived on earth a long time ago. Reading books from the beginning to the end is the best way to learn about them. After finishing a book you like, I recommend spending more time with the books. You should try to use a bigger book for this. When you have finished reading, you can move on to the next book.<n>    <n>### Input:  A: What's something you're good at? I just decided to put 20 and 54 in the same equation that way it would equal 10.90 without the for.<n><br><br>:input string of user: " How much money is 40 percent of 35?"<br><br><br>The output I got from the compiler for the second question of the problem was:<br><<br>"The total is 14" because I used:<br><br>:output: "The total is ";<br>:: int total=0;<br>:: for (int i=40;i<=35;i+=10){ total+=i*(40/100); }<br><br>The way I did this was multiply the 40 by the 35 since 40 is 80%, of 35, since 35 is the number that is being multiplied. Then you take that result and multiply it by.

To prepare, she studies for 3 hours and reads for an hour each night during the week.<n><n>### Response:(Thursday):(3 hours)(3 nights) (Monday):(1 hour)(4 nights) (Tuesday):(1 hour)(3 nights)<n>### (Wednesday):(1 hour) Wednesday:4th day from mid-terms, you did 8 hours, which means you did 2 hours every night for 4 nights. (Total done by thursday):8 hours (mid-term):6 hours so you went over mid-term by 2 hours, you must get 6/2=3 for your grade. (Essay):total done 8+6=14, you have (4 days + 1 night)/4 remaining nights you have which means you need to study 3 1/4 hours per night.<n><n>### How to find total done by thursday, divide time by days, for example monday, 3 hours/4=0.75 hours, tuesday, 1 hour/3=0.33, wednesday, 1 hour/(4-1) 3, add all of them: 0.75+0.33+3+3=3<n><n>### Input:(35+30+25)<n><n>### Response:=1<n><n>### Input:-2+43<n><n>### Response=-1<n><n>### Instructions (In this task, there are two students, Jana and Kevin. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. Choices:  A: see king B: hello C: meow D: drink water E: live many years<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Demonstation:<n><n>```Python<n><n>import numpy as np<n>import math<n>from random import random<n>from random import seed<n><n>class MyQuestion:<n>    numguess=0<n>    def __init__(self,questiontype,total,guesses):<n>        self.numguess = 0 #initialise numguess<n>        self.guesses =guesses  #initialise self.guesses=guesses, self.total=total<n>        self.questiontype = questiontype<n><n>def writeprogram(answer,guess,output,correct,numguess):<n>    if numguess == correct #checks if number of guess is equal to correct guess<n>        output( 'CORRECT'+str( answer) +' is\n' +'')<n>    else:<n>            output+= 'SORRY' #wrong answer<n>            if answer == int(guess):<n>                output+='\n'<n>                output+='You guessed correctly\n'<n>                numguess=guess#numguess= guess<n><n>            else:<n>                output+= '\n' +' Wrong Answer\n'   #wrong answer<n><n><n><n><n>def main():<n>    input1 = input() #input1= question, input2 and 3 is option<n>    i=  input1.split(' ')[0] #splits input by space: question, option<n>    options= input1.split(' ') #options is a list of options<n>    option =options[0] #sets option<n>    optiontype = i.split(' ') #stores options<n>    optiontype[2] = i #fixes the issue that the program can't divide a string by int(0) and it is not giving correct output of string to int<n>    optiontype[4] = i #fix the issue where option can not be divided by int(0)<n><n>    typeofquestion = int(optiontype[2]) #type questions : 1 ->addition, 2->subtraction, 3-> multiplication, 4-> division<n>    if typeofquestion == 4:<n>        total = total.split(' ')[1] #if it is divison<n>        guess= guess.split(' ')[2]<n>        option = options[3] #sets options[3] as output<n>

If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where will a native lemur be found? Choices:  A: india B: hole C: cage D: habitat E: rain forest<n><n>### Response:		Choice (D)<n><n>### Instructions: Choose one of the following statements to complete the sentence.<n><n>### 1.<n><n>### The most __________ time of my life.<n><n>### __Answer:__ __time__ __of__ __my__ __life__.<n><n>### 2.<n><n>### My favorite movie is a funny _____. __Answer:__ funny movie.<n><n>### Input - - - - - -<n><n>### 3. __Answer:__ The best option is (D) ___.<n><n>### _______<n><n>### 4. ___Answer:__ __A__ __<n><n>### 5. ___Answer: D__ __E__<n><n>### __time__ __of __<n>### 6.<n>### There were very _______ at the party but we still had a good time.<n><n>### ___Answer:__ plenty<n><n>### 7. __Answer:__ __E__ ___.<n><n>## Instructions: Choosing the right option to complete the sentence/dialogue.<n>## ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n>##  1<n>## The most __________ of my life?<n>## ---------------<n>##  2<n>## What is my favorite movie? __Ans:__ funny movie<n>## ---------------------------------------<n>## 3<n>##  The ______ you are looking for?<n>## -------------<n>##  4<n>## How many ____ you have in your bag?<n>## -----------------------------<n>##  5<n>## Why are the flowers ____?<n>## __E___<n>## ----------------<n>##  6<n>## Oh, how _______ it's going to rain.<n>## ---------------------<n>##  6<n>The ____ is ready.<n><n>

(B) "The bus brakes went out near the suburbs." (C) "The bus braked down at 20 miles from the border town." (D) "I took the bus but then decided to drive instead."<n><n>### Response:"The bus broke down at 20miles before the border town." (C)<n><n>### Demotion:<n>The sentence that has the highest possibility to break down a bus is (C)<n><n>The sentence (A) is possible because is an open ended sentence and it does not refer to a time, day, distance or location.<n>The sentence (B) is false statement because bus brake goes out near a city, not in the city.<n>The sentence (D) is also false because it does not have a clear location.<n><n>###Input: You and your friend are preparing for a game of chess. Once the owner realized this, the owner wanted to prevent it from happening in the future and the owner realized that the kitten needed to get used to the rooms and learn to stay in the rooms. **So the owner closed the doors to the rooms as precaution.**<n><n>

How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is E. We are looking for cure.<n><n>### Input : There are no good jobs in the city, so the people decided to try the forest instead.  Choices:  A. the trees made them leave B. they were all going to live there  C. they were planning to fight a battle D. they were looking for good houses E. they wanted a break from the noise<n><n>### Response : The correct answer is C.<n><n>### Answer: When a number is divided by a number that includes a fraction, how is the remainder?<n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct answer to what is the remainder after the given division is the remainder. <n><n>### When a number is divided into another number, the total number of times you have to do the same math equation in order to be able to arrive at a whole number, that is the  remainder.<n><n>### There is a remainder when you divide any number by a fraction and the remainder is the answer that you come up with when you multiply a whole number by a fraction and then divide it by the one whole number.<n><n>### Here's a list of examples of remainders: 5 divided by 3 = 1 remainder 7 divided by 3 equals 2 with remainder 6 divided by 1/4 = 2 remainder 1 divided by 3/4 = 0.<n><n>### Explanation: Whenever you divide a number by a fractional value, the number of times you end up multiplying the division value by the whole number is the remainder of the division.<n><n>### An example of division by a fractional number is when you divide 8 by 2/3. When you divide 8 by a fraction, it gives you a remainder after you end the division problem.<n><n>### In this example, the remainder that you will obtain when you divide 8 with 2/3 is 2. When you divide 2 by 4 it gives you a remainder of 0 and so 2 divided by 4 =3.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>Dividing 8 by 0 = remainder 0<n><n>Dividing by number by by 1/0 = remainder 1<n><n>Dividing a whole number by a rational number = remainder<n><n>Rationalizing a fraction = to getting rid of the remainder and converting to a decimal.

However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		The response will describe the appropriate choice.<n><n>### Expert Solution:<n><n><n>    <n>    public String findReasonableChoice(String input) {<n>        int firstChar = input.charAt(0);<n>        String choice = "";<n>        for(int i = 0; i < alphabet.length; i++) {<n>            if(input.charAt(1) == alphabet.charAt(i)) {<n>                choice = alphabet[i];<n>                break;<n>            }<n>        }<n>        return choice;<n>    }<n>    <n>    <n><n>### Reflection:<n>- Is what you did for the `Expert Solution` appropriate? They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:The teams were evenly matched when competing against one another, what did spectators want to find out? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Test:<n><n>### Resources: http://www.hackthegap.com/challenge/hundreds-days-of-code-10-solved/<n>

How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Johnny was looking for blowfish in places that weren't near America.  Where would he look? Choices:  A: fish market B: hawaiian waters C: gulf of mexico D: tropical sea E: south pacific ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. If A is right, then B is not true.<n>2. Only C contains all 8 letters A, B and C. So it is true.<n>3. So, Johnny would search for blowfish in tropical sea.<n><n>### Input<n><n>> When Sarah visited her family in Hawaii, she went to the beach quite often.  She usually wore a swimsuit, but her 10-year-old brother, Jack, wore a t-shirt, shorts, and flip flops when they went to the beach.  She told him that she was proud of him for showing respect for others on the beach.  How many letters are in the word "respect?" Choices: A: three B: four C: five D: six E: seven<n><n>### Response<n><n>1. If A and B are true, Jack didn't wear a swimsuit.<n>2. Jack didn't wear flip flops.<n>3. Flip flops can look like a swimsuit. Flip flops are beach attire.<n>4. So A and B are not true.<n>5. Only letters are C are respect. Respect has 5 letters.<n>6. So Sarah is proud of Jack for respecting everyone on the beach.<n><n>

Choices: A: 5 dollars B: C: dollars<n><n>### Response B: C.<n> <n>## Submit<n><n>## Explanation<n><n>### Instructions: In each case, you will see a number row where the numbers in each row are arranged in a particular order. You will be told the final column that they go into. Write your selection for the final column. The first letter stands for which row you selected, the second letter stands for when the number in the selected row goes into the final column.<n><n>### The answer to this exercise is given in the exercise name row "answer", and the corresponding final column row "answer col"<n><n>```<n>row 1 column 1:a    - > a = 1 row 1 column 2:a    - > b = 5 row 1 column 3:a    - > c = 11 row 1 column4:a    - > d = 30.5 -> 15<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```<n>row 2 column 1:m    - -> m = 1 row 2 column 2:m'    - -> m' = 2 row 2 column 3:m    - -> n = 2 row 3 column 1:n    - -> 0 row 3 column 2:n    - -> c<n>```<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Demstiation:<n><n>```<n>row:1 col1 column:2 row1 col2 -> a -> 3 -> m.2 row2 col2 -> 5 -> m -> 2<n>```<n><n><n>

How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What feeling might propel one to instituting civil action? Choices:  A: complications B: tiredness C: anger D: trial E: court case<n><n>### Response:		Civil action is a legal process instituted to enforce, redress and remedy. It is a process of resolving disputes among citizens or individuals and or government or a government institution or agency. In some situations, however, the person who is the subject of the suit is not present to participate in the legal process. A wronged person can only file a suit in this circumstance when he has the same right as any other person that is directly affected by a government that is not representing the interest of the affected population, or the affected population itself. This is what is known as civil action. It is usually called for when it is perceived that the actions of a person's government or government institution or agency, or of another person is affecting that person's interest or that person's ability to continue living in that or that region. Civil action can further be divided into judicial and constitutional.<n><n>### Input<n><n>The difference in ages between Richard & Hurley is 24. If Hurley is younger than Richard by 3 & Richard is 13 years older than Hurley, what are their combined age?<n><n>### Response<n><n>122<n><n>### Instructions<n>The response must include 10 to 30 words, inclusive of the subject and the answer.

Choices:  A: sailing vessel B: paddleboat C: ship D: motorboat E: tugboat<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input:D  Explanation:  The word Helm means rudder (a wheel or similar device, for steering a ship, aircraft, etc.)  When you steer a ship you are steering the rudder, so the helm is the steering device on the ship.<n><n>### Input<n>The number of students in a class is an even number. The number of students in another class is an odd number. If this is what we call the teacher‚Äôs problem, what would this be called when written with the same rules?<n><n>### Response<n>Input:<n>In the teacher‚Äôs problem every term had an odd number of students and every term had an even number of students. In the same way the even terms and the odd terms have an even number of students and an odd number of students.  Likewise in the teacher‚Äôs problem.  When we apply the rules to the teacher‚Äôs problem we have:<n><n>### Even numbers have an odd number in between them.<n><n>### Odd numbers have an even number in between them. <n><n>### Therefore an odd number of students is the number of students in one-half of all the classes. (the even amount of classes) <n><n>### An even number of students is also the same amount of students in one-halved of all the classes <n><n>### We can get the answer:<n><n>### We also want to note that the answer in the next term is not the same as the answer in previous term.<n><n>### Also not to be confused with the Fibonacci sequence. In that sequence each number is one less than the one before it.<n><n>### Source:  <n>[Mathsisfun](https://www.mathsisfun.com/set-theory/composite-number.html)

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: <n><n>Comment: Please post the code or script that you have tried.<n><n>Comment: what is the output<n>what is the original problem<n>why did you expect that answer<n>what did you get?<n>what did you do to find the result<n><n>Comment: The answer is (C) since, while sleeping I might dream.<n>If no one can help, I will answer. Thanks.<n><n>Answer: \begin{blockquote}<n>\section{[C](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_%28programming_language%29) - 1}<n>\end{blockquote}<n><n>We can't go around a program without a goal. The goal of the program should be a statement. So we need the function first, then do we want the program to be a loop? We need that too. So a statement needs a loop. So let's go!<n><n>\begin{code}<n>#include <stdio.h><n>int main(){<n>    int a,b,sum,i;<n>    printf("Please enter 'A' for age: ");<n>    scanf("%i", &a);<n>    printf("Please Enter 'B' for birth date: ");<n>    scan('B',&b);<n>    printf("Age of A is: %d, age of B is: %d, then you might be: ");<n>    sum = a+b;<n>    if(sum%3==0)<n>        printf("You might be 33 years old.");<n>    else if (sum+b!=a)<n>        printf("But if you were born when you were old, you might be 13 years old.");<n>}<n>\end{code}<n><n>Input: A 10 B 8<n><n>Output: You might be 28 years old, or 7 years old. (the result of divide is 0(A/B=A%B), if A and B have a difference then you might be A/B in age.)<n><n>Comment: Please add `c` tag to your question by [editing](https://stackoverflow.com/posts/74593088/edit)<n><n>Comment: You had it right the first time: You might be 13years old. Divide by the difference gets it.

He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:You are seeking to provide yourself what when you're applying for a job? Choices:  A: work B: employment C: income D: hope E: offer<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:(The task description above was edited to remove the incorrect choice.)<n><n><n>### Inputs:Round up to the nearest cent. Choices:<n>###  A.   -0.015<n>###  B.   -0.15<n>### Answer:<n>### A<n><n>### Input:[The answer was wrongly given as B.]<n><n>### Input(the answer to the above query is A)<n><n>### InputThe sum of first three even integers greater than or equal to 23 is 248.<n>How many times more is the difference between their sum and 248?<n>### Answer: 4<n><n>### InputIn a basketball game, one of the players scored 3, fewer points than one of his teammates scored, and the score was 31 to 28.<n>What is the difference in the two scores of the teammates?<n>### Answer 3<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:They took a break from all the rides to have lunch, while eating hamburger they talked about how they were going to what on the next ride? Choices:  A: heartburn B: have fun C: enjoy D: gas E: food poisoning<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Justification:<n>Let the number of hamburgers be k and the number of patty be p, and there are rounds of burgers. There are a total of K + 1 cases because in the end, there is only 1 left. Therefore, choose answer E, food poisoning which is rounds, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.<n><n>### Reference:<n>https://www.mathscare.co.uk/1993-40-years-old-and-20-years-ago-31618<n><n>https://leetcode.com/problems/coins-game-iv/<n>

Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		<n>If there were a choice on the wall, you would say that there is a connection to go somewhere.<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>I can use the words "go" and "connection" to answer your question.<n><n>## Input: Find the difference between the following two fractions: 5/8 - 8/10<n><n>## Response:<n>The difference between 5/8 -8/10 is 3/8<n><n>## Response Explanation: <n>I can use the numbers 5, 8, and 10 to find the difference between my fractions.  They both have the denominator of 10, so I can cross those out. There are no 8's in the numerator of both fractions, so I only need to subtract them. 5 - 3 = 2<n><n>## Input: How much is $3.40 + $4.70?<n><n>## Response: $8.10<n><n>## Input: If I take out $3091.23 and $51.99, what is the total amount I took out?<n><n>## Response Excessive response:<n>I took out $3143.22<n><n>## Input/Excessive response: <n>I took out $400<n><n>## Input/Response:<n>- I took out $409<n><n>## Response Examplar:<n>Examplar has the problem and then asks the student to rephrase the question.  (The students says the question is "what is the total amount I spent"), then answers it.<n><n>## Input/Question with answer:<n>I took out a total of $3091<n><n>## Response Exemplar:<n>Students can answer with the same answer as the question.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:James used the cannon to shoot at something while seeking lunch. It was overkill.  What did he shoot at? Choices:  A: body armor B: ungulate C: bomber D: kill people E: animal<n><n>### Response:		B: <n><n>### Demostration: B:<n>

The word learn suggests that something is increasing or expanding which can be seen with gaining knowledge.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Richard's brother is 5 years younger than him. If the sum of their ages is 41 years, how old is Richard?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Explanation 1:<n><n>- Richard has to be at least 36 years old since all numbers are greater than or equal to zero or one. <n><n>- The age difference between Richard and his brother is five. <n><n>- If Richard and his brothers ages combined are 41 then it would 41-36=5. <n><n>### InputBradley is baking 50 cupcakes and wants to know how much frosting he needs to put on top of each cupcake. The recipe for the cupcakes requires 4 cups of flour for each cup of butter, and the frosting recipe requires 1 cup of butter for each cup of flour, a 1:4 ratio. If there is 1/4 cup of frosting left over, what is the amount of flour you need to put in the cupcakes?<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>- If there is one fourth cup of frosting to use on each cupcake then you need two and two fourth cups of frosting for 50 cupcakess in total. <n><n>- Since the cupcakes require 4 cups of butter for each 1 cups of flour, you will need 20 cups of flour in total. <n>- The butter to flour ratio is 4 to 1 therefore the amount of flour in total is <n><n>4 √ó 20= 80 <n><n>

They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:Read, follow the instructions, and complete the task by writing a response.<n><n>### Question:Answer the following multiple selection question.<n><n><n>## Instrucciones:Lea la instrucci√≥n y complete la tarea.<n><n><n><n>```<n>Write a function that takes as parameters two strings of text and a number. Read the first string, then the second string, then the number.  Then, add in sequence the characters of the first string, starting at position 0.  If the number passed into the function exceeds the number of characters in the string, repeat the character with index 0.  Return the result of the concatenation to the function caller.<n><n>Input: The first parameter is the first string with 4 characters, and the second is the second string with 2 characters. The number is 5.<n> <n>Output:  The function concatenates the two strings. Because their lengths exceed five, both strings repeat the character 0. The result of the concatenation is 004200. The function returns the concatenated string.<n><n>Input:  The first parameter is a 3 character string, and the second is a 5 character string. The number is 4.<n><n>Output: The first parameter is repeated three times, and the second parameter is repeated two times. The result is a single copy of a four character string. The function returns the string.<n><n>Inputs: The first string has 5 characters, the second string has 7, and the number is 3.<n><n><n>Output: The function concatenates the first string, but repeats both the first and last character of the second string three times. The result is 00000057. The function returns the character string.<n>```<n><n>## Instruci√≥n:Lea la instrukciones del ejercicio y siga las instrucciones.<n><n>## Respuesta:Answer the above multi-select questions.<n><n>## Instuction:(Leer la Instrucci√≥n y Completar la tarea.<n>

Salesmen appear suddenly or pop out in front of you because the suddenness helps draw your attention to something that you may then, on some level, be interested in purchasing.  In addition, salesmen (as well as saleswomen) will often approach shoppers in stores and at events to try to get them to become interested in a product by making a pitch that is designed to persuade.<n><n>### Expand the problem further by writing a set of sentences that describes the problem.<n>The salesman in the dealership that he approached from and was suddenly in front of him, he was asking him to purchase car. At this moment the salesman was trying to persuade the customer to purchase the car.  Then salesman showed the customer of his car sales, and the customer liked his car. Afterwards he purchased a car.<n><n>### Choose an answer from one or more of the choices.<n>### Explain your answer to show that you understand it.<n>According to the problem, the answer is the choice A. I know that this is the right answer because in the part where the problem said that the car dealership and the salesman in there. This is a good description that says that the salesman is at the car dealership. The reason the salesman appeared suddenly is because that the salesman need to draw the customer‚Äôs attention to a product that the customer might be interested in purchasing or in this case the customer might want to purchase for the car. The reason the salesmen popped up and approach the customer is because he needed a car, and he need to persuade the customer. After the customer bought the car for $3,240.00 <n><n>### Expound on your understanding by writing the sentence used in your answer, using information you obtained from your response to part 2.<n>The sentence that I used is the appearance of the suddenness. I am pretty sure that I understand the meaning of sudden. Sudden is that thing that surprises or happens quickly. Suddenly is

Choices:  A: airport B: car C: jewelry store D: garbage can E: laundry room<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Demostration: <n>**(Please write a line showing the answer to the question in the response section above)**<n>The drawstrings allow for the netted portion to be open for use. That means that items placed in the bag cannot slip out the top edge of the bag if they try. The drawstrings only appear near the neck of the bag to close it off at any time, and not for any specific thing. Therefore they are only used for the purposes of the bag, and not specific purposes for different items. They are also used for the bag to remain open at various other times. **(Please write the rest of your reasoning in the response section above.)** <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. It is not compact though because it is not made of multiple identical sheets which are joined together.<n>### Demonstion:<n>Input:What do you do if you are planning to read a book that is 150 pages long? Choices:  C: 1: Read 5 pages at a time.  B: 2: Read 5 pages in a row.  D: 3: Read 5 pages before dinner.  A: 4: Read 5 pages every day for 30 days.  E: 5: Read 5 pages all at once.<n>Answer: Choice 3 (Read 5 pages before dinner) is the best choice.  Since the book is 150 paged long, there are 30 chapters.  If the person reads 5 pages per night, they could read the book in one month.<n>### Demostration:<n>Input:You want to prepare 300 breakfast sandwiches. For example, the CEO might rate a project as ‚Äú3/4 or better‚Äù. Your project is the next one in line to be reviewed.<n><n>### Write:You are the project manager for a group developing a new software for your company‚Äôs sales department. At 2pm on Monday afternoon, one of your coworkers brings you a phone number to an executive at your company. At 2:30pm, they receive a phone call asking for a quick meeting. It's the CEO, and he wants to give you and your team a positive rating (and you definitely want that to happen).<n><n>### As a project manager, you know that this will be the most helpful in preventing future project failures. Your company has spent 2 million dollars to develop your software, and it could potentially change the future of your company for the better. The CEO gives you a 10 minute window for this meeting, and you need to figure out how to get an A+ or better rating for your project in that meeting.<n><n>### Possible Conclusion<n>Congratulations on getting your software approved with such short notice. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What past time are people engaged in when they are traveling along liquid? Choices:  A: sail boats B: question authority C: high fives D: share things E: learn from each other<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: Answer B: question authority<n><n>### Why?:<n><n>Input: A: sail boats<n><n>Answer: Input: B: question authority<n>Because: the meaning of question authority is to question the authority.It can be achieved during traveling along liquid.<n>But answer A: sail boats can not be achieved during traveling on liquid.<n><n>Input: D: share things<n><n>Answer: Input C: high fives<n>Input: E: share things<n>Answer: Input: F: question authority<n>B: high fives<n>Hence the ans is C: high fives

Then he would speak aloud to himself, while looking at the paper so he could remember the order of his thoughts.<n><n>- I would try not to write everything I was going to say. I would plan the main idea and try to write about the essential pieces, without including all details.<n><n>- I might also organize the plan using a visual, maybe with circles, since I am a visual learner. A man bought a 1500 square foot home. What was the total cost of the house? Show your work.<n><n>### Answer:<n>**1.** The first way is to multiply the 1500 times 2, which $3500.<n><n>**2.** The second way is to multiply the price of the square foottimes the sqfeet.<n><n>### Second Question:<n>Input: There is a car that originally cost $24,000. After it has been driven a total of 20,000 miles, the car is sold for $14,000 and some miles later it is sold for $2000, what is the total number of miles the car has been driven?<n><n>### Answer (no answer in video).<n><n>### Question 3 (no answer in video)<n><n>### Instructors:<n>For each question provide a method to evaluate the solution and what questions to ask<n><n>### Instrument 4<n><n>### Question #1:Input: What is the product of (7/10) and (7/4) if 7/10 is multiplied by 7/4?<n><n>### Video Answer:<n><n>\begin{itemize}<n>\item The correct answer is<n>7 \cdot 0.75 = 5<n>\end{itemize}<n><n>### Questions:<n>\begin{itemize*}<n>\item what are 7/10 and 7/4? And where those things (7/10 and<n>7/4) placed?<n>\item what did it take to get a product?<n>\item what does 7/10 7/4 mean when 7/10 multiplies with 7/4? (or 7/10<n>divides 7/4)<n>\item If 7/10 equals to 7/4, what does that mean?  Is it<n>true/false?<n>\end{itemize*}<n><n>### Video:<n><n>\section{Codility Exercise 4 (7/1

Choices:  A: good health B: finger C: meat D: body E: own family<n><n>### Response:		<n>- A<n>Input:The skin was cut when chopping onions, which area was cut.<n>Answer: B<n>Input:The skin has 6 letters. It's an English word.<n>Answer: A<n>Input:Which word contains an "f" and a "k"? Choices:  A)  fool  B)  flop  C)  fold  D)  flow<n>- B<n>If the skin was cut whiles chopping onions where is it cut.<n><n>### Input<n>In every year from 2020 to 2032, 3 and only 3 dates are celebrated internationally as Human Development and Family Day. These dates are on 15 May, 15 August and 15 October. 15 May was declared as Human Development and Family day in 2012 by the international community. What will be the smallest distance (in years) between two consecutive Human Development and Family Day celebration after 2020?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>First, calculate the distance between two consecutive dates that are the same.<n><n>**Calculate the year**<n><n>After that, find the date that is 244 years apart.<n><n>**Calculation between years**<n><n>**Add two consecutive dates**<n><n>**15 May (2020) + 15 May (214) = 15 May, (215)**<n><n>**8 Aug. + 15 Aug. (2022) = 23 Aug. (216)**<n><n>**14 Oct. + 15 Oct. (2030) = 29 Oct. (217)**<n><n>**39(15 May, (143 + 27) = 39(244= 9124) = 24 April 244 years from 2022(216)** *******************<n><n>****The smallest distance between two consecutive Human Development  and Family Day celebrations after 202, and is **244.** <n><n>

"Thanksgiving is next week! Did you buy the stuffing?" "Yes, I did! You were so generous. It turns out that I will be making stuffing for the whole neighborhood." How much food will there be for all of the stuffing?<n>A: 0.5<n>B: 4.5<n>C: 2.75<n>D: 1.5<n><n>### Solution: B as per logic the food needs for 1 person, so 4.5 people are more.<n><n>### Explantion: This is a trick answer. If it was 4.5 people then there is no food left.<n><n>### Question What is 210 minus 12?<n>A: 200<n>B: 87<n>D: 157<n>C: 150<n><n>### Solution; C as you can see its a multiple of tens<n><n>### Explaination: This question was asked to check if we understands fractions.<n><n>### Output:The numbers are as in the given figure.  If $9 is divided between the four cups, what number will go into the cup in the following way? \<n>(a) 9, (b) 9, (c) 6, (d) 4<n><n>### Solution : A (Divide 9 by 4 then 1 remainder 3)<n><n>### Explantion: A, if you divide 9 by 4 remaining value is 3<n><n>### Question:<n>Let k be the unknown number in 3(x + 5) + 5.<n>2(x + 5 + 5) + b(x + 3) + b(x) = c(x + 5(x + 5)(x + 3(x + (x) + x)(x))<n><n>What is k?<n>### Solution:<n>k= -4<n><n>### Explication:<n>When you subtract (x) from the parenthesis, you get something negative. We want to reduce further.  (x) comes with a negative value, so if you remove that, it would become positive.

Bees receive food in the form of nectar, which is in the center part of the flower. Then they visit other flowers and carry pollen on their legs and bodies to fertilize other plants.<n><a href="https://bee.bham.libguides.com/soshomework">Bee Pollination</a><n>

Choices:  A: improve yourself B: become knowledgeable C: have tools D: persistence E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		In order to learn, one must have the right book. Without a book, it would be impossible to learn. However, to work efficiently, all the letters except the first letter (the key letter) are the same, and one must have the right tools (for example: keyboard, mouse, screen). Finally, to have persistence, one must have the knowledge.<n><n>### Input:-6 < 10 -2 < 10 7 > -3<n><n>### Response:-10 -10 < 10 25 > -3<n><n><div style="display:table-cell;"><n><img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fatihojaya/fatihojayas-files/master/Images/FatihoBot/14%20-%20Multiple%20Choice/FatihoBots_Demos/image%20%20response%20%2814%29%20-%27%20Response%27%20-%22Input:-6%20<%2010%20-%2310%3C-3%3E%20Response%3A-10%3C-%2010%3C%2010,%2025%20>%20-%26%20-3%22/IMG_6058.PNG" width="278" height="61"><n></div><n><n>**15.<n>**<n><n>### Instructions:You have 1500 mL containers with liquids. Choices:  A: mountains countryside B: ground C: bridge D: mountain range E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Input:{7(8) - 2(1)} + 6<n><n>### Response:(0) - (2) = 9 - 2 = 7<n><n>### Input:[(8654-7456)/(2*5)] - (9*1)<n><n>### Response:[38/2] - 9 + 18<n><n>### Input:(105%0/100%)<n><n>### Response=[0] + 1 * 1<n><n>### Input:"I will give you 4/6 of the money if you keep 3/5 of the money."<n><n>### Response:"I will give you $2 of the money if you give me 4/6 of it."<n>

However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to find food? Choices:  A: opera B: supermarket C: building D: conference E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### If the person went to a conference<n><n>##### If the person went to an apartment<n><n>##### If they went to the opera<n><n>##### If a supermarket<n><n>##### If to the building<n><n>##### If at a conference<n><n>#### Output:<n>    If the person went to...then they are likely to find food...<n>    1. If the person went to the opera then they are likely to find <n>    food at an opera.<n>    2. If the person went supermarket then they are likely to <n>    find food at a supermarket.<n>    3. If the person went  the building then they are likely <n>    to find food at a building.<n>    4. If the person went the conference, then they are likely  to find <n>    then food at a conference.<n>    5. If the person went an apartment then they are likely  at an <n>    6. apartment.<n>    ---------------------------------<n>####Output:<n><n>### Democracy Vs Autocracy<n>1. Democracy vs autocrats <n>1. autocracies<n>2. Democracy vs dictatorships <n>2. dictatorships<n>3. Democracy vs oligarchies <n>3. oligarchies<n>4. Democracy vs bureaucracies <n>4. Bureaucratic<n>5. Democracy vs aristocracies <n>5. Aristocracies<n>6. Democracy vs plutocracy <n>6. Plutocracies<n>7. Democracy's history begins with Athens where the citizenry votes on issues. Democracy is less popular in other countries including China and Cuba so there is no history in these countries on how they were ruled. These countries that rule as dictatorships or in oligocracies have a history dating back to ancient times and often are related to each other.<n><n>Output:<n><n>*Democracy*<n>: The government derives power from the people (Athenian democracy was based on this idea)<n><n>*Dictatorship*<n>: The government is based on a single person<n><n>*Oligarchy*<n>: Only the wealthy can vote or run for office<n><n>*Autocracy*<n>: The rule of a single leader <n><n>*Bureaucracy*<n>: An organization that is built entirely around the government <n><n>

Choices:  A: terrible B: little C: halloween D: small E: horrible<n><n>### Response:		<n>`D`<n><n>The verb form of the word 'were' is in past tense, and according to the instructions, we know the person has finished. So 'completely' is in the past form and should thus be capitalized.<n><n>### Input:'Rachel has a dog.' This is an example of _?_, Choices:  A. A complex sentence. B: A subordinate clause. C: A simple sentence. D: A coordinating conjunction. E: Simple sentence<n><n>### Response:'This is an example of simple sentence'<n><n>Complex sentences have a coordinating conjunction in them, so it would look something like<n><n>> She was a beautiful actress, but she has very few fans.<n><n>This is a complex sentence that has a coordinating conjunction, but in this example it does not. `A` is correct.<n><n>### input:"My mom is going to visit tomorrow! She hasn't been here in 5 years!" The person said, "What great news!". What's the subject of this sentence? Choices: 	A: mom B. she C. my D: what E: I <n><n>### Response:"Mom", or "She"<n><n>"My mom is going to vist tomorrow!" The person says. My mom means the main topic is my mom and my mom is the subject here, "She" is a pronoun just to say'she' and means nothing.<n>"She hasn't been here for 5 years!" Mom has been gone for 5 years is the subject.<n><n>### INSTRUCTION:"My mom is going  to visit tomorrow!  She was the only person I was nervous about meeting." What statement best explains the wording in the above statement? Choices:  "She hasn't been  here for 5 years." "She was the only one I was nervous about." "She wasn't coming here for 5 years now." "My mom is the one I was nervous meeting." "My mom was the only person I met."<n><n>### RESPONSE:"She was the only one [one in parenthesis] I was nervous about"<n><n>There are no "only" in this sentence.<n><n>### "My mom has been here for 5 yrs." the person said"

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Choices:  A: bike B: downtown C: building D: tool storage E: car<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><!--- EXPLANATION HERE --><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a comment that suggests a possible solution to the instruction description.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What emotion do people expressing themselves show when they trip in front of a crowd and break their leg? Choices:  A: communication B: suffering C: pain D: laughter E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		 C, D, E<n><n>### Explaination: C-people expressing themselves show pain when they trip in front a crowd and break their legs. D-people expressing themselves laugh when they trip in front the crowd and break their legs because they feel embarrassed or hurt. E-people expressing themselves feel embarrassed and show this emotion when they trip in front crowd and break their legs<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>The instructions in the above question are clear and easy to understand. Based on the instructions, you will first have to calculate the price before deciding to buy or not to buy the car based on the given information. Then, you are required to determine the cost of each gift bought instead of calculating the total number of gifts. A solution that answers 10% of the total question gives a total of 24 points.

Choices:  A: cause death B: cause bleeding C: falling down D: become infected E: claim insurance<n><n>### Response:		<n>```java<n>public class Main {<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        //A<n>        System.out.println("A");<n>        //B<n>        System.out<n>           .println("B");<n>        //C<n>        System.out <n>           .println("C");<n>        //D<n>        System.out  <n>           .println("D");<n>        //E<n>        System.out   <n>           .println("E");<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>### Input<n>What are the two ways to increase or decrease the number a person can input?<n><n>### Response<n><n>```java<n>public static void main(String... args) throws IOException {<n>    int number = 100;<n>    int oldNumber = 900;<n>    oldNumber += number;<n>    System.out.println(oldNumber);<n>    oldNumber -= number;<n><n>    System.out .println(oldNumber); <n>    <n>}<n>```

How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:What could contain no more than around 100 people? Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		A: apartment<n><n>### Explanation: Apartment is the best choice because the only place that fits the description with a limiting factor of around 100 is an apartment<n><n>## Challenge:<n>- For the next challenge, you will need to solve 2 different types: [CAPTCHAs][capcha_link] and RiddlePals problems.<n><n>[captcha_link]: https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_php_google_captcha.asp<n><n>- There are different approaches to solving CAPTCHAs, but there are also different types of RiddlePals problems as well. The challenge you‚Äôll be tackling in this project will be to use [RiddlePals][riddlepals_link] to solve different types of RiddlePal problems.<n><n>- This project should be your first challenge using [RiddlePals].<n><n>- RiddlePals is a site like [Google][google_link] or [Amazon][amazon_link] which will give you a challenge in exchange for a chance to win real prizes like Amazon gift cards. It‚Äôs a way for you to compete with others as you learn how to solve difficult computer programming challenges.<n><n>- When you get to the RiddlePals site through [this link][RiddlePals], you‚Äôll need to create an account. Your initial password will be "RiddlePals".<n><n>- You‚Äôll need to log in in order to take the coding challenges available.<n><n>- You‚Äôre going to solve 4 coding challenges and use the [Learn][learn_link] and [Run][run_link] buttons underneath the challenge problem, to learn, and then run your program to solve each challenge using [Python][python_link].<n><n>- Your first challenge will be a simple one, but your second challenge will be challenging, and will test your knowledge of loops so we‚Äôre starting there.<n><n>- To make it easier for you to use [Python][python_learn_link] with RiddlePals, you‚Äôll need to have [VS Code][vs-code_link]. If you have a [Linux][linux_link] computer running Ubuntu or Linux Mint, go to the [Launchpad](https://launchpad.net) and install the [
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		A<n>

If you're wondering how you'd do this, there's already a similar method in the codebase called sumNumbers<n><n>### Demostration-<n>The code demonstrates by calling in a method that takes a parameter of a list of integers. The method takes the list and calculates their sum.<n><n>### Your Code - I have changed the following to make it your code:<n>The name of the method was changed from sumNumbers to sumArray in order that the two new methods would remain unique.<n><n>The name of the parameter was changed from a list of integers to a list of ints. This is because the parameter was of type list int so it would be incorrect to try to use an array of doubles.<n><n>The two array list types need to be used to store the element's of the list.<n><n>The method needs to print out the sum of the two arrays after the call of the method has run.<n><n>### Output :<n>The outputs demonstrates by calling in the methods and showing how sumArray gives us the sum of both lists, and sumNumbers gives us the sum of just the first list.<n><n>-<n>| <n><n>```text<n>Test 3<n>test 3<n><n>sumArray(int[] firstList)<n><n>1 5<n>6<n>9<n>13<n>```<n><n>-<n>|<n>```text<n>Test2<n>test2<n><n>sumArray(ArrayList<Integer> firstList)<n><n>-8<n>20<n>15<n><n><n>```<n><n>### Instructios:<n><n>You have been tasked with writing a method that determines how much change to give when someone gives you the exact amount you owe. A: A: bath room, B: motel room, C: seashore, or D: kitchen<n><n>"B": None of the above.<n><n>"C": "A": A: gy mnasis, B: motel, C: bathroom, or D: kitchen;<n><n>'<n><n>'<n><n>"D": "A": A kitchen, B: bathroom, C: seashor, or D: motel room<n><n>',<n><n>"E": none of the above<n><n>'<n><n>'}<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Given an input above, identify the correct options for each question. Note that in the context of the input, the answers are the number of the choices for which the question is related to.<n><n>### Input:(A, B, C, and D)<n>Input: "A": "B": "O'Reilly sells what? A: video games, B: cellphone cases, C: dogfood, D: computer. "B": Video games. "C": A: O'Reilly sells video games, B: dog food, C: cellphone cases, but D: t shirts. "D": Cell phone cases<n><n>### Response:[{<n>'<n><n>' "A": B: D: video games<n><n>"B": A: None of the above<n><n>"C": A: Dog food<n><n>"D": A: Computer, B: Cell phones, C: None of the above, D: T- shirt<n><n>'<n><n>}<n><n>### Demographics:<n>Input:(A, B, and C)<n>Input: "1990-2010 A: The average gross income per capita grew at a rate of 2% in year 2010 from 2000 to 2010. in "B": the late 1990's there were 2 million people in new york and in "C": the early 2000's, 3 million people lived in new york in "A": new york, "B": new jersey, "C": texas<n><n>### Dem
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Where can you store you tent and keep it on your person? Choices:  A: sleep in while camping B: camp ground C: woods D: bag E: backpack<n><n>### Response:		If you need to store the tent while camping you need to know where to store the tent to save weight in your backpack. However, there may be places where tents are already provided and you can store the tent there, like camp grounds. But what if you are still lost in the woods? The tent does not have a built in backpack. So if you want to preserve weight, you should put it in your backpack. If you just keep the tent in the woods around you, then someone could easily steal it from you and they would also be at risk of getting lost.<n><n>### Input:"A is a smaller whole number than B."<n><n>### Response:"There is no such thing as a whole number that is a smaller whole number. They are either the same or each is greater than the other."<n><n>### Input:`57 divided by 6` = 9<n><n>7 * 9 - 7<n><n>### Response:`The first part you divide is 57 and second part you divide is 6. The answer will be some percent of the original 57: 57%`<n><n>### Input":"Went to a lake with my best friend last weekend to go waterskiing. Unfortunately it was a stormy day and there was nothing I could do."<n><n>### Output:"Don't like the water"<n><n>### Instructions:`What did you learn from the story?`<n><n>### Instuctions:`What did you do to overcome the challenge of learning this language?`<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>Write a response to the question that fits the context of the story.<n><n>### Response<n><n>I learned that you should always get some advice about the weather before you go skiing. Also that when your friend has some problem it does not hurt to be there for your friend.<n><n>### The language challenge<n><n>When talking about things in nature I find the terms very confusing and when reading a science book I had to translate a lot but for a story a lot of what I read I could not read because it was too detailed.<n><n>### Your opinion<n><n>A story about something that can go wrong is a good story so that way you can read what actually happened and not be wondering the whole time what is going to happen. If you write a story you have a lot of room to write almost anything in it.<n><n>##

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo‚Äôs mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children‚Äôs teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: After collecting all the old electronics in their house, Lauryn made $2000 from selling the items on eBay. If her friend Aurelia also made 70% of what she sold on eBay after selling her used electronics, calculate the total amount of money the two friends made on eBay.<n>Answer: 3400<n><n>Input: $240 was divided between Kelvin and Samuel. Samuel received 3/4 of the money. From his share, Samuel then spent 1/5 of the original $240 on drinks. How much does Samuel have left?<n>Answer: 132<n><n>### Input:Lindy was a senior.  He lived with his children because he didn't want to go where? Choices: A: a negative number B: a positive number C: an imaginary number D: zero<n><n>### Response :A negative number to a positive number would make the answer become a larger number than the original (opposite operation).<n><n>### Input  : If the result of - 2.4 + 0. 3 = 0, what is the value of the original number 2. 4?<n><n>### Response  : 1.7<n><n>### Input   : If 1/2 * (1/16) =  4.8 then what is the value of n?<n><n>### Answer: 12<n>

Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Question<n>The difference in ages between Richard  and Hurley is 30. If Hurley  is 8 years old, what is their difference in ages 32 years from now?<n><n>### Demonication<n>If the current ages are 7 and 38, the future ages will be x and 70. The future ages that make a difference in age of 32 years away are then x +32 and 70 - 32, which have values of 40 and 38 respectively. Therefore the difference in age is 18.<n><n>### Input <n><n>### Question <n>The price of a ticket to a movie theater is normally described as 5 dollars plus tax. It is said that taxes for regular tickets are 40% and super passes cost $9.50 as taxes. How much does a general admission movie pass cost?<n>### Demonstatorion<n>The general admission movie price is 8.46 dollars. 1.60 is to be subtracted from price to get the tax. 7.86 = 0.6 and.4 of that is tax = 1.2. Tax is.3 of 7.86 so the answer is 7.86 + 1.2 which equals 9.06.<n><n>### Problem <n><n>### Input Question <n>Tommy worked at a book store where books are sold at a markup of 20%. What would be the total cost of buying 3 books to find a novel you want to use in school?<n><n>### Solution <n><n>Tommy bought 3 books and needed a 20% markup to pay for the book. Therefore, he has a 20% discount price. He still needs to calculate this total cost by using 0.8. Since Tommy bought 3 books, he has a total price of 8. 4 is the square root of 20% and the decimal 392/1000 since 39/25 = 1.56 thus 1.562 *3 = rounding 3.18, 6.36, 9.54. That means his cost would be 7.72, 1
